page.title: 07HOUSING
page.content: Most of the houses in the Roundhay area are Victorian or Edwardian detached and semi-detached houses. They are large family houses constructed in brick and stone, with slate roofs. Many have attics, cellars, and bay windows decorated with stained glass. The area of Roundhay Park has a few large villas around the perimeter interspersed with large detached houses, some recently built, and some over 100 years old. One Victorian dwelling overlooking the park and known as Parc Mount, has been converted to a hotel. Behind this is a large block of luxury penthouses. Also adjoining are single storey stone alm houses, built by the Nicholson family who previously owned Roundhay Park for their aged retired servants. To the North is an old farm and buildings known as The Grange,now a pig farm.
